holidays.name: National Book Lovers Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate all the bookworms and bibliophiles out there by diving into your favorite novels or discovering new literary gems.
holidays.origin: While not officially declared by any government, this day has become a popular reading celebration on social media and among book clubs worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that reading for just six minutes can reduce stress levels by 68%! Perfect excuse to cozy up with a book today.

holidays.name: National Rice Pudding Day

holidays.origin: Originated in the United States as part of food-themed days to celebrate beloved comfort foods.
holidays.funFact: Rice pudding dates back to ancient civilizations‚Äîthe Romans enjoyed a similar dish called 'pultes.'

holidays.name: National Dollar Day (USA)
holidays.description: This day marks the anniversary of the first issuance of the U.S. dollar as the official currency, paying homage to the iconic bill in your wallet.
holidays.origin: Commemorates August 9, 1792, when the Coinage Act established the U.S. dollar as the country's standard unit of money.
holidays.funFact: The $1 bill has featured George Washington since 1869, making him the most represented American on currency.

holidays.name: National Women's Day (South Africa)
holidays.description: A significant public holiday in South Africa, celebrating the role and achievements of women in society and commemorating the 1956 march against apartheid pass laws.
holidays.origin: Established in 1994 to honor the historic 1956 women's march to the Union Buildings in Pretoria.
holidays.funFact: The 1956 march involved over 20,000 women protesting apartheid‚Äîa powerful moment of unity and courage.
